content.description: Route trends left then up. Steep finger sized crack
content.location: Same as The Big Eddie. 2 bolt anchor at the top. Use gyattp anchor for descent.

content.description: Head left to clip 3 bolts. Fun slab moves. Rest is crack climbing. Same anchor as Snowshoes.
content.location: Start from a traditional anchor at the start of Snowshoes of EP.

content.description: Normally starts with a short traverse, or can go up a wide crack to start.  As climber loses sight of the belayer, can do an awkward squeeze move straight up or traverse left on a small ledge and then up, clipping the only bolt on the route.  At end of first pitch, anchor is up and right.  Have explored further up to a pin anchor on p2 another ~70' up staying left of the arete, but not recommended (yet).  Someday will finish this to the top.
content.protection: Trad rack.  2 bolts with rings for anchor at the top of p1.
content.location: This route is to the right of the other climbs at this area.  Just left of Castle Direct.

content.description: Start up a ramp to the left.  Then up steeper terrain up to a bolted anchor under a roof.  A short and easier second pitch takes you to the 2nd anchor on Diggin it.  Traverses out to the right.  Most of this climb stays dry in the rain.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Nice to have a 4" cam on the traverse near the top.
content.location: This climb starts at the top of the first pitch of Diggin It.  And (for now at least) ends at the top of the 2nd pitch of Diggin it.

content.description:
Pitch 1 - Scramble left on the ramp to the base of the crack.  Friendly steep 5.8 climbing leads to stiff 5.10c roof move protected by steel nuts.  The crux can be bypassed on the right keeping the overall rating of the route to 5.10a.

 Pitch 2 - easy 5.6 climbing leads to an exit move from the corner.

 Pitch 3 - Hike the clean ramp up to a wide, low-angle dihedral protected by a bolt (5.10a).  A few thin cracks lead to a dramatic finish (5.9).  

 Requires full rack to 3" including TCUs and steel nuts.  Rappel the route with a single 60m rope or scramble off the back side.
content.protection: Traditional with one bolt plus bolted anchors.

content.description: Stiff and steep.  Will continue to clean up over time.
content.location: Starts at a crack between Dead Marmot and Ramparts Rampage.

content.description: Short but strenuous hand crack followed by easier ground up to a grassy ledge. Hand tape would help on this on.
content.protection: Traditional rack.  Use trad anchor. Hike off or use anchor further to the right to rappel down.
content.location: Straight up from the start of Rampart's Rampage

climbs.name: Get your ass to the pass (GYATTP)

content.description:
First pitch heads to the right of a large roof. 5.9 variation if you go left at the roof. 

 2nd pitch mostly finger size crack with 1 bolt at traverse to the right near the end.
content.location: Hike up a gully and traverse left on a ledge to the start of the route.

content.description:
Crack between snowshoes and The Big Eddie. 

 Thin and steep
content.location: Same start and anchor as Snowshoes

content.description: 5.7, 5.10b, 5.8.  First pitch is 5.7, 3 bolts near the arete.  3 bolted anchors.  No bolts on 2nd pitch, 1 bolt on 3rd pitch.  Variations exist.  Last part of 2nd pitch can go up a chimney to the right, or straight up a crack to the bolted anchor.  3 single rope rappels to the base.
content.protection: Mostly trad. 4 bolts and bolted anchors.  Bring small wired steel nuts or RPs for p2.
content.location: Hike about 10 minutes to the left past Independence Mine Crag.  Start at base of the arete, located <100' to the right of Ramparts Rampage.  Alternate 1rst pitch options to the left and right.

content.description: Bolted line heads up left side of the steep orange wall
content.protection: May want gear to supplement the bolts

content.description: Cruxy in the middle.  Variations exist to the left and right of the middle section
content.location: Bolted anchor at the start and end.  Not a clean way to get to the start.  Working on that still.  Approach from top of Necessary Evil or Dead Marmot.

Climb lower pitch of gyattp then walk along ledge to the left to the base of the route. 20-30 feet. Or climb lower pitch which has lots of grass ledges. NR esp if its wet out.

 4 climbs start from this natural anchor location. Use gyattp anchor to rappel down.

content.description: First move is a wide crack or second can climb clean face on the left.  2 bolts are located near the middle.  Strenuous slightly overhanging moves on trad gear after the bolts and veers left near the top.
content.location: Furthest right climb at this crag.  Next formation to right of Diggin it.

content.description: Great morning sun. Mostly crack climbs in the 5.9 - 5.10 range.
